content.text: Let's talk about hobbies! You'll learn how to say what you like to do in your free time, or 'tempo libero'.

data.meaning: What do you like to do?

content.text: After 'Mi piace', you can add a verb to say what you like to do. For example, 'Mi piace leggere' (I like to read).

data.tip: The 'ci' combo in Italian is pronounced like 'ch' in 'cheese'.

content.title: Sharing Your Hobbies
content.setting: You're at a social gathering and someone asks about your hobbies.

conversation_flow.title: Mention a sport you enjoy
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ciao! Mi chiamo Sofia. Cosa ti piace fare nel tempo libero?

extract_info.hobby_1: Extract the sport or activity the user mentions

conversation_flow.title: Mention another activity you enjoy
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Bello! Anche a me piace {hobby_1}. Ti piace fare altro?

conversation_flow.title: Say how often you do an activity

content.text: Great start! Now let's add more detail. You'll learn to say *why* you like something and what you *don't* like.

data.tip: The accent on the 'é' is important. It tells you to stress that final syllable.

content.title: Adding More Detail
content.setting: The conversation continues. Explain more about your interests.

conversation_flow.title: Explain why you like your hobby
Mention something you don't like
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Capisco. C'è qualcosa che non ti piace fare?

conversation_flow.title: State your weekend plans
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ah ok. E cosa fai questo weekend?

content.text: Excellent! The final step in a good conversation is to show interest in the other person.
Use 'E a te?' to easily ask the same question back to someone. It's short for 'E a te cosa piace fare?'

content.title: Showing Interest
content.setting: Now, turn the conversation around and ask Sofia about her hobbies.

conversation_flow.title: Ask what she likes to do
Ask where she does her hobby
Express that you find her hobby interesting
